materials.name: M-HIPA (M = Mn, Fe, Co, Ni and Zn)

synthesis_conditions.details: See experimental details in Supporting Information

synthesis_conditions.crystal_structure: Includes crystallographically independent one Co, one HIPA2@ and three water molecules
synthesis_conditions.coordination_environment: The Co atom in an octahedral environment is bound to three O atoms from two HIPA2@ ligands, positioned in the equatorial plane. The three remaining coordination sites are occupied by water molecules
synthesis_conditions.structure_linkage: The HIPA2@ links the Co atoms resulting in a chain structure
synthesis_conditions.hydrogen_bonding: Abundant O@H···O hydrogen bonding between water molecules and the oxygen containing groups results in a three-dimensional supramolecular network based on the chains

synthesis_conditions.note: Similar synthesis conditions as Co-HIPA due to their isostructural nature

materials.name: Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA after electrolyte soaking

synthesis_conditions.PXRD_patterns: Not changed compared with the original patterns, indicating high stability
synthesis_conditions.morphologies: Studied by optical microscope, SEM and EDS elemental mapping, also indicating high electrolyte stability

synthesis_conditions.cycling_performance: Co-HIPA exhibited reversible charge capacities of 1043 mAh g@1 with the capacity retentions of 95.1 % after 200 cycles. Ni-HIPA exhibited reversible charge capacities of 532 mAh g@1 with the capacity retentions of 71.4 % after 200 cycles
synthesis_conditions.rate_performance: Co-HIPA achieved stable capacities of 820/750 mAh g@1 at 1000/2000 mA g@1 after 1000 cycles. Ni-HIPA achieved stable capacities of 375/304 mAh g@1 at 1000/2000 mA g@1 after 1000 cycles
